Content:
Hello all, question about asset chain creations...
is it possible to use -ac_eras  and -ac_staked together to change the PoW/PoS %?
so something on the line of 1st era to have 80% PoW and 20% PoS
then 2nd era to have 60% PoW and 40% PoS 
and so on with each era.....

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: eras doesnt work on that

Author: dude#6062
Content: i didn't think so, had to ask tho... thank you

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is possible to do, but someone would have to do it

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: changing pow/pos % at certain heights will make your difficulty do really weird things. When coins change their pow algo's, they are very careful to make sure their difficulty changes over smoothly instead of making drastic changes. Just another thought. But if you really want to do it, fork KMD and write the C++ üòÉ

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I was having issues compiling komodod from `jl777` branch on osx. cclib was first issue. solved it with this:

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
```
brew install boost
brew install libsodium
brew install berkeley-db4

cd src/cc/rogue
CC=gcc-6 ./configure
make

#changed cc/rogue/Makefile
CC=gcc-6



# changes in src/cc/Makefile

CC = gcc-6
CC_DARWIN = g++-6


# changes in makecclib
gcc-6 -std=c++11 -I../univalue/include -I../cryptoconditions/include -I../cryptoconditions/src -I../cryptoconditions/src/asn -I.. -I. -fPIC -shared -c -o ../libcc.so cclib.cpp -L/usr/local/Cellar/boost/1.68.0_1/lib -I/usr/local/Cellar/boost/1.68.0_1/include -L/usr/local/Cellar/libsodium/1.0.17/lib -I/usr/local/Cellar/libsodium/1.0.17/include -L/usr/local/opt/berkeley-db@4/lib -I/usr/local/opt/berkeley-db@4/include
```

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
CC üôÇ 
@ca333

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: CC @SHossain

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @grewalsatinder are you able to simply set `CC=gcc-6` in your shell ? and why CC vs CC_DARWIN using diff compilers?

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Yes as shell command

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: setting CC in your bash shell should work, if not, that is a bug in the build system, imho

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: you shouldn't have to set and change it multiple places/times

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: For darwin I did not try

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: CC=gcc-6 ./configure; make

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i believe i have done stuff like that, but not with this new rogue/cc code

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: True, it's just the steps I took to resolve my issue

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Must be flexible I guess

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: $(CC) should be inherited from the environment, is all I am saying. I don't *think* you need to modify Makefiles, and if you do, I feel that is a bug

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
True mate, I was not trying to make solid solution 
Just shared how I solved mine üòÅ
